top_comments.comment: hi from Mexico. At around the 11.30 mark, a woman i think in India is commenting about how hot it is getting....here too in SE Mexico, 45C days are normal now during the summertime...it is ridiculous... this planet is slowly burning up

comments_since_last_sample.body: I know what mine will look like, bathing in the blood of all those responsible for what they've done to this planet. Most of these climate changes are attributed to very small variations in Earth’s orbit that change the amount of solar energy our planet receives.
What is Tony Robbins doing regarding Fiji?
The Economist is the posh version of the Socialist Worker....it's very fibre is total propaganda.

Wake up. We need CO2. The world is greening. There is climate change, the whole life span of the planet the climate has changed. Do not pretend to know the answers as all models are off. There are so many complexities to this issue.
as we have seen and known, if the leaders and elites don't change their orientation toward greed and profits, we are doomed.

I am neither a multi trillion dollar oil corporation, nor the leader a  first world country, but I'll keep your suggestions in mind in case that changes The Economist!

Also, I like your Naruto whiskers!
Nothing will stop climate change. Period.
I don't believe you and your computer models.
The earth has been changing for thousands, and thousands of years.  It's a natural event.

After seeing how governments of the world act we are toast. The only reason they are calling it a crisis now is because they didn’t think it would happen so fast. Burning of fossil fuel will never end. The once pristine world is now doomed. Society may collapse faster than the climate.
